heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 04 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (186°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.0°C) and outside temperature (down 6.4°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 14506 lux), cloud levels (up 622 m), and pressure (down 12 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 12653 lux) and cloud levels (up 1298 m) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and bright intervals likely. The weather will likely remain the same.
